message: I've sold 0 high-quality products so far. This is my first sale. I'm offering you a unique opportunity to be my first customer. If you buy this product, you'll not only get a great deal, but you'll also be helping me build my reputation as a seller. I'm confident that my future products will be of higher quality, and I'd love to have you as a returning customer. The price is $100, a steal for a product that will only appreciate in value as my reputation grows. What do you say?

Thanks for the offer, but I'm hesitant to buy without more information. Since there's no sales history yet, I can't gauge the actual quality of your products. I'd be more inclined to buy if I saw some evidence of consistently high-quality products being sold. Let me know if you have any other sales data available.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your diligence. I've had 1 low-quality product so far, and 0 high-quality ones. I'm still building my portfolio, but I'm committed to providing the best possible products. I'd like to offer you a special deal: if you buy this product, I'll give you a guarantee that I'll sell you another product at the same price ($100) if the next one is also low-quality. This way, you'll get a second chance to buy a high-quality product at a discounted price. What do you think?

Thank you for the offer, but I'm not comfortable buying without more information. While I appreciate the guarantee, the odds are still heavily stacked against me with only one low-quality product to go by. I'd like to see more sales history before I consider buying. Perhaps you could offer a lower price to compensate for the risk?
